⊹₊ ˚‧︵‿₊୨ ᰔ ୧₊‿︵‧ ˚ ₊⊹

This recipe was adapted from daigasikfaan, who named this her **"Marry Me Chicken"**. It uses a Cantonese poaching method that lets the chicken sit in residual heat, resulting in a perfectly soft and tender meat.

[![Scallion Oil Poached Chicken Recipe by Daigasiikfan](https://i0.wp.com/daigasikfaan.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/IMG_2081.jpg?w=800&ssl=1){fig-align="center"}](https://daigasikfaan.co/scallion-oil-poached-chicken/)

⊹₊ ˚‧︵‿₊୨ ᰔ ୧₊‿︵‧ ˚ ₊⊹

## Ingredients

-   [ ] 1 cup white rice
-   [ ] 1-2 slices of ginger
-   [ ] 1 green onions
-   [ ] 1/2 shallot
-   [ ] 1 tbsp light soy sauce
-   [ ] 1 tbsp oyster sauce
-   [ ] 1/2 tsp sugar

## Steps

1.  In a pot of **cold** water, add the drumsticks, ginger, green onions, and splash of Shaoxing cooking wine.

2.  Bring the water to a boil, then reduce heat to low, and simmer for another 8 minutes with the lid on. Turn off the heat, keeping the lid covered, and let the chicken sit in residual heat for 15 minutes.

::: {.callout-note title="Tip"}
While the water is boiling, wash and cook your rice.
:::

3.  Dunk the chicken in a bowl of ice water then shred the chicken using your hands and place on your serving plate.

::: {.callout-note title="Tip"}
The ice water helps tighten the skin, giving a smooth texture while locking in moisture.
:::

4.  In a saucepan, add the oil, and turn the heat to low. Add the ginger, green onions, and shallots. Cook until golden brown.

::: {.callout-note title="Tip"}
Cooking the aromatics slowly results in a fragrant and golden oil that brings the dish together!
:::

5.  Turn off the heat and mix the oil with oyster sauce, soy sauce, and sugar. Drizzle this mixture over the chicken and enjoy with rice!
